alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 5:21AM CST until March 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, Southeast Missouri and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden and Mississippi. In Southeast Missouri, Pemiscot. In West Tennessee, Dyer, Lake, Lauderdale, Obion, Shelby and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dyersburg, Millington, Covington, Ripley, Osceola, Luxora, Wilson, Fort Pillow State Park, Reelfoot Lake State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Munford, Tiptonville, Brighton, Halls, Ridgely, Heloise, Ashport, Unionville, Ft Pillow and Bradleytown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
